Definition: Non-purgeable organic carbon (NPOC) from water extractions of sediment samples that were subsequently analyzed on the FTICR-MS.
Percent total nitrogen in < 2 millimeter sediment samples. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.
Percent total organic carbon in < 2 millimeter sediment samples. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.

Delta 13 C. Stable isotopic composition of carbon (delta carbon-13/carbon-12).  Presented in units of permil, also known as per mil, per mille, or parts per thousand. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.

Delta 15 N. Stable isotopic composition of nitrogen (delta nitrogen-15/nitrogen-14).  Presented in units of permil, also known as per mil, per mille, or parts per thousand. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.

Sample ID where the replicates for sediment samples are: U is upstream; M is midstream; and D is downstream.

Name of the sample. The format is S19S_####_[Material indicator]. Each unique sample name refers to all samples from a given sampling event (point in space and time; assigned a Sample ID formatted as S19S_####) of a given material (i.e. "sediment"; "water;" or "RNA" for filter). The beginning of the sample name (before "_[Material indicator]") can be mapped directly to the Sample IDs used throughout the data package.
